description: Erection of a single storey rear extension, replacement of rear ground and first floor windows and removal of basement window
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON
To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Access to the flat roof over the extension hereby approved shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, balcony, patio or similar amenity area.
REASON
To prevent overlooking to adjoining properties in accordance with policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

Prior to the commencement of development, product details of all external materials, finishes and colours (where relevant) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. All external materials and finishes shall be in keeping with the traditional construction of the listed building. Works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained thereafter.
REASON:

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the listed building, in accordance to policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 (Nov 2012), policies DMHB 1 and 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 (Jan 2020), The London Plan (2021) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Prior to the commencement of development, a detailed scaled drawing showing the connection between the flat roof and rear elevation of the original historic building shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Scaled drawings shall be no more than 1:20 in scale. Works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained thereafter.
REASON:

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the listed building, in accordance to policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 (Nov 2012), policies DMHB 1 and 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 (Jan 2020), The London Plan (2021) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Prior to the commencement of relevant works, product details and scaled elevations and sections of all new windows shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Scaled drawings shall be no more than 1:10 in scale. Works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained thereafter.
REASON:

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the listed building, in accordance to policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 (Nov 2012), policies DMHB 1 and 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 (Jan 2020), The London Plan (2021) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the details shown on the submitted plans, numbers 1121-01A, 1121-02A, 1121-04B, 1121-05B and shall thereafter be retained/maintained for as long as the development remains in existence.
REASON
To ensure the development complies with the provisions of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (January 2020) and the London Plan (2021).

Prior to the commencement of relevant works, details of how the basement window opening shall be blocked up, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Scaled drawings shall be no more than 1:10 in scale. Works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained thereafter.
REASON:

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the listed building, in accordance to policy HE1 of Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 1 (Nov 2012), policies DMHB 1 and 2 of the Hillingdon's Local Plan: Part 2 (Jan 2020), The London Plan (2021) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no additional windows, doors or other openings shall be constructed in the walls or roof slopes of the development hereby approved.
REASON
To prevent overlooking to adjoining properties in accordance with policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).
